intro: Phyllanthus punctulatus, commonly known as the punctulate phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green, round leaves with distinctive white or yellow spots. The plant produces small yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
